Class ObjectDetection

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          ObjectDetection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ObjectDetection
extends java.lang.Exception

Class that determines the identity of an unknown obstacle

Version:
3.0 November 28 2013
Author:
Vanessa Jones, Christopher Petryna, Simon Lei, Taylor Dotsikas, Muhammad Hannan and Caroline Wu

Constructor Detail

ObjectDetection

public ObjectDetection(UltrasonicSensor us1,
                       UltrasonicSensor us2,
                       Odometer odo)
Constructor method to import the two ultrasonic sensors and odometer

Parameters:
us1 - import the ultrasonic sensor located on the TOP of the robot
us2 - import the ultrasonic sensor located at the BOTTOM of the robot
odo - import the odometer that is also used by the navigation class
Method Detail

findObject

public double[] findObject()
                    throws ObjectDetection.ObjectNotFoundException
Finds location of a styrofoam block and gives the coordinates for the block

Returns:
the x and y coordinates of a styrofoam block
Throws:
ObjectNotFoundException - if no styrofoam blocks are found after one run-through
ObjectDetection.ObjectNotFoundException

isBlue

public boolean isBlue()
Determines the identity of an unknown block

Returns:
the identity of the obstacle. Returns true is the block is a blue Styrofoam block and false otherwise.

isObstacle

public boolean isObstacle()
Determines if there is an obstacle ahead

Returns:
true if there is an obstacle ahead, false if otherwise

getFilteredData

public int getFilteredData(UltrasonicSensor us)
Method to get filtered data from the ultrasonic sensors

Parameters:
us - imports the ultrasonic sensor we want to find the filtered data for
Returns:
returns filtered data read by the ultrasonic sensor

getFilteredData

public int getFilteredData()
Method to get filtered data from the bottom ultrasonic sensors

Returns:
returns filtered distance read by the ultrasonic sensor

public int falseNeg()
Method to get filtered data from the bottom ultrasonic sensors

returns filtered distance read by the ultrasonic sensor
